# floatValue

**Instance Property**

The cell’s value as a single-precision floating-point number.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var floatValue: Float { get set }
```

## Discussion

This property uses the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell/objectValue] property to access the actual value. If the cell is not a text-type cell or the cell’s value is not scannable, this property contains the value `0`.

## Managing Cell Values

- **objectValue**: The cell’s value as an Objective-C object.
- **hasValidObjectValue**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the cell has a valid object value.
- **intValue**: The cell’s value as an integer.
- **integerValue**: The cell’s value as an integer value.
- **stringValue**: The cell’s value as a string.
- **doubleValue**: The cell’s value as a double-precision floating-point number.
